div.l: (base) Now trewely / how sore that me smerte
(base) Quod he / to Atthenes right now wol I fare
(base) Ne for the drede of deeth / shal I nat spare
(base) To se my lady / that I loue and serue
(base) In hir presence / I recche nat to sterue
(base) ¶ And with that word / he caughte a greet Mirour
(base) And saugh / that chaunged was al his colour
(base) And saugh his visage / al in another kynde
(base) And right anoon / it ran hym in his mynde
(base) That sith his face / was so disfigured
(base) Of maladie / the which he hadde endured
(base) He myghte wel / if that he bar hym lowe
(base) Lyue in Atthenes / eueremoore vnknowe
(base) And seen his lady / wel ny / day by day
(base) And right anoon / he chaunged his array
(base) And cladde hym / as a poure laborer
(base) And al allone / saue oonly a Squyer
(base) That knew his pryuetee / and al his cas
(base) Which was disgised / pourely as he was
(base) To Atthenes / is he goon / the nexte way
(base) And to the Court he wente vpon a day
(base) And at the gate / he profreth his seruyse
(base) To drugge and drawe / what so men wol deuyse
(base) ¶ And shortly / of this matere / for to seyn
(base) He fil in office / with a Chambreleyn
(base) The which / that dwellyng was wtith Emelye
(base) For he was wys / and koude soone espye
(base) Of euery seruant which that serueth here
(base) Wel koude he / hewen wode / and water bere
(base) For he was yong . and myghty for the nones
(base) And ther to / he was strong and byg of bones
(base) To doon / what any wight kan hym deuyse
(base) A yeer / or two / he was in this seruyse
(base) Page of the chambre / of Emelie the brighte
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And Philostrate / he seyde that he highte
(base) ¶ But half so wel biloued a man / as he
(base) Ne was ther neuere in Court of his degree
(base) He was so gentil / of condicioun
(base) That thurgh out al the Court was his renoun
(base) They seiden / that it were a charitee
(base) That Theseus / wolde enhauncen his degree
(base) And putten hym / in worshipful seruyse
(base) Ther as he myghte / his vertu excercise
(base) And thus with Inne a while / his name is spronge
(base) Bothe of his dedes / and his goode tonge
(base) That Theseus / hath taken hym so ner
(base) That of his chambre / he made hym a Squier
(base) And gaf hym gold / to mayntene his degree
(base) And eek men broghte hym / out of his contree
(base) Fro yeer to yeer / ful pryuely his rente
(base) But honestly / and sleighly / he it spente
(base) That no man wondred / how that he it hadde
(base) And thre yeer in this wise / his lyf he ladde
(base) And bar hym so / in pees / and ek in werre
(base) Ther was no man / that Theseus hath derre
(base) And in this blisse / lete I now Arcite
(base) And speke I wole / of Palamon alite
(base) ¶ In derknesse / and horrible / and strong prisoun
(base) This seuen yeer / hath seten Palamoun
(base) Forpyned / what for wo / and for distresse
(base) Who feeleth / double soor / and heuynesse
(base) But Palamon / that loue destreyneth so
(base) That wood out of his wit he gooth for wo
(base) And eek ther to / he is a prisoner
(base) Perpetuelly / nat oonly for a yer
(base) Who koude ryme / in englissh proprely
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) His martirdom / for sothe it am noght I
(base) Therfore I passe / as lightly / as I may
(base) ¶ It fil / that / in that seuenthe yeer of May
(base) I wylle not taire yow alle the day
(base) The thridde nyght . as olde bokes seyn
(base) That al this storie / tellen moore pleyn
(base) Were it by auenture / or destynee
(base) As whan a thyng is shapen / it shal be
(base) That soone after the mydnyght Palamoun
(base) By helpyng of a freend / brak his prisoun
(base) And fleeth the Citee / faste as he may go
(base) For he hadde yeue / his Gailler drynke so
(base) Of a Clarree / maad of certeyn wyn
(base) With Nercotikes / and opye / of Thebes fyn / /
(base) That al that nyght . thogh that men wolde hym shake
(base) The Gailler sleep / he myghte noght awake
(base) ¶ And thus he fleeth / as faste as euere he may
(base) The nyght was short and faste by the day
(base) That nedes cost he moste hymseluen hyde
(base) And til a groue / faste ther bisyde
(base) With dreedful foot thanne stalketh Palamoun
(base) For shortly / this was his opynyoun
(base) That in that groue / he wolde hym hyde al day
(base) And in the nyght thanne wolde he take his way
(base) To Thebesward / his freendes for to preye
(base) On Theseus / to helpe hym to werreye
(base) And shortly / outher he wolde lese his lyf /
(base) Or wynnen Emelie / vnto his wyf
(base) This is the effect and his entente pleyn
(base) ¶ Now wol I turne / to Arcite ageyn
(base) That litel wiste / how neigh that was his care
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Til that Fortune / hadde broght hym / in the snare
(base) ¶ The bisy larke / messager of day
(base) Salueth in hir song the morwe gray
(base) And firy Phebus / riseth vp so brighte
(base) That al the Orient . laugheth of the lighte
(base) And with his stremes / dryeth in the greues
(base) The siluer dropes / hangynge on the leues
(base) And Arcita / that in the Court roial
(base) With Theseus / is Squyer principal
(base) Is risen / and looketh on the murye day
(base) And for to doon / his obseruance to May
(base) Remembrynge / on the point of his desir
(base) He on a Courser / startlynge as the fir
(base) Is riden in to the feldes / hym to pleye
(base) Out of the Court . were it a myle / or tweye
(base) And to the groue / of which that I yow tolde
(base) By auenture / his wey he gan to holde
(base) To maken hym / a gerland of the greues
(base) Were it of wodebynde / or hawethorn leues
(base) And loude he soong . ayein the sonne shene
(base) May / with alle thy floures / and thy grene
(base) Wel come be thow / faire fresshe May
(base) In hope / that I som grene gete may
(base) And from his courser / with a lusty herte
(base) In to the groue / ful hastily he sterte
(base) And in a path / he rometh vp and doun
(base) Ther as by auenture / this Palamoun
(base) Was in a bussh / that no man myghte hym se
(base) For soore afered / of his deeth was he
(base) No thyng knew he / that it was Arcite
(base) God woot he wolde haue trowed it ful lite
(base) But sooth is seyd / go sithen many yeris
(base) That feeld hath eyen / and the wode hath erys
(base) It is ful fair / a man to bere hym euene
(base) For alday meeten men / at vnset steuene
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) As I ful ofte / haue toold thee her biforn
(base) And hast byiaped here / duc Theseus
(base) And falsly / chaunged hast thy name thus
(base) I wol be deed / or ellis thow shalt dye
(base) Thow shalt noght / loue my lady Emelye
(base) But I wol loue hire oonly / and namo
(base) For I am Palamon / thy mortal foo
(base) And thogh that I / no wepne haue in this place
(base) But out of prisoun / am astert by grace
(base) I drede noght that outher thow shalt dye
(base) Or thow ne shalt noght louen Emelye
(base) Chees which thow wolt or thow shalt noght asterte
(base) ¶ This Arcite / with ful despitous herte
(base) Whan he hym knew / and hadde his tale herd
(base) As fiers as leoun / pulled out his swerd
(base) As fers as a liou saide thus be god that sittith aboue
(base) And seyde thus / by god that sitteth aboue
(base) Nere it that thow art syk and wood for loue
(base) And eek that thow / no wepne hast in this place
(base) Thow sholdest neuere / out of this groue pace
(base) But out of prisoun art y stert by grace
(base) That thow ne sholdest dyen of myn hond
(base) For I diffye / the seuretee and the bond
(base) Which that thow seist that I haue maad to thee
(base) What verray fool / thynk wel that loue is free
(base) And I wol loue hire / maugree al thy myght
(base) ¶ But for as muche / as thow art a worthy knyght
(base) And wilnest to darreyne hire by bataille
(base) Haue here my trouthe / tomorwe I nyl nat faille
(base) Withouten wityng of any oother wight
(base) That here I wol be founden / as a knyght
(base) And bryngen harneys / right ynogh for thee
(base) And chees the beste / and leef the worste to me
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And mete and drynke / this nyght wol I brynge
(base) Ynogh for thee / and clothes for thy beddynge
(base) And if so be / that thow my lady wynne
(base) And sle me in this wode / ther I am Inne
(base) Thow mayst wel haue thy lady / as for me
(base) ¶ This Palamon answerde / I graunte it thee
(base) And thus they been departed / til amorwe
(base) Whan ech of hem / hadde leyd his feith to borwe
(base) ¶ O Cupide / out of alle charitee
(base) O regne / that wolde no felawe haue to thee
(base) Ful sooth is seyd / that loue ne lordshipe
(base) Wol noght his thankes / haue no felaweshipe
(base) Wel fynden that Arcite and Palamoun
(base) ¶ Arcite / is riden anoon / vnto the town
(base) And on the morwe / er it were dayes lyght
(base) Ful priuely / two harneys hath he dyght
(base) Bothe suffisaunt and mete to darreyne
(base) The bataille in the feeld / bitwix hem tweyne
(base) And on his hors / allone / as he was born
(base) He carieth al this harneys / hym biforn
(base) And in the groue / at tyme and place yset
(base) This Arcite / and this Palamon been met
(base) ¶ To chaungen / gan the colour in hir face
(base) Right as the hunterys / in the regne of Trace
(base) That stonden at the gappe / with a spere
(base) Whanne hunted is / the leoun or the Bere
(base) And hereth hym / come russhynge in the greues
(base) And breketh / bothe bowes / and the leues
(base) And thynketh / here cometh my mortal enemy
(base) Withoute faille / he moot be deed / or .I.
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) For outher / I moot sleen hym / at the gappe
(base) Or he moot sle me / if that me myshappe
(base) So ferden they / in chaungyng of hir hewe
(base) As fer / as euerich / oother of hem knewe
(base) ¶ Ther nas no good day / ne no saluynge
(base) But streight withouten word / or rehersynge
(base) Euerich of hem / heelp for to armen oother
(base) As frendly / as he weere / his owene brother
(base) And after that with sharpe speres stronge
(base) They foynen / ech at oother / wonder longe
(base) Thou myghtest wene / that this Palamoun
(base) In his fightyng were a wood leoun
(base) And as a crewel Tygre / was Arcite
(base) As wilde boores / gonnen they to smyte
(base) That frothen / whit as foom / for Ire wood
(base) Vp to the Anclees / foghte they in hir blood
(base) And in this wise / I lete hem fightyng dwelle
(base) And forth I wole / of Theseus yow telle
(base) ¶ The destynee / Ministre general
(base) That executeth / in the world oueral
(base) The purueiance / that god hath seyn biforn
(base) So stroong it is / that thogh the world hadde sworn
(base) The contrarie of a thyng by ye / or nay
(base) Yet som tyme / it shal fallen on a day
(base) That falleth nat eft / with Inne a thousand yeer
(base) For certeinly / oure appetites heer
(base) Be it of werre / or pees / or hate / or loue
(base) Al is this ruled / by the sighte aboue
(base) ¶ This mene I now / by myghty Theseus
(base) That for to hunten / is so desirus
(base) And namely / at the grete hert in May
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) That in his bed / ther daweth hym no day
(base) That he nys clad / and redy for to ryde
(base) With hunte and horn / and houndes hym bisyde
(base) For in his huntyng hath he swich delit
(base) That it is / al his ioye and appetit
(base) To been hymself the grete hertes bane
(base) For after Mars / he serueth now Diane
(base) ¶ Cleer was the day / as I haue told er this
(base) And Theseus / with alle ioye and blys
(base) With his ypolita / the faire queene
(base) And Emelie / clothed al in greene
(base) On huntyng be they riden roially
(base) And to the groue / that stood ful faste by
(base) In which ther was an hert as men hym tolde
(base) Duc Theseus / the streighte wey hath holde
(base) And to the launde / he rideth hym ful right
(base) For thider was the hert wont haue his flight
(base) And ouer a brook / and so forth on his weye
(base) This duc / wol han a cours at hym / or tweye
(base) With houndes swiche / as that hym list comaunde
(base) And whan this Duc. was come vnto the launde
(base) Vnder the sonne he looketh / and anon
(base) He was war / of Arcite and Palamoun
(base) That foghten breme / as it were boles two
(base) The brighte swerdes / wenten to and fro
(base) So hidously / that with the leeste strook
(base) It semed / as it wolde felle an ook
(base) But what they weere / no thyng he ne woot
(base) This Duc his courser / with the spores smoot
(base) And at a stert he was bitwix hem two
(base) And pulled out a swerd / and cryed hoo
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) ¶ To speke of roial lynage / and richesse
(base) Thogh that she weere a queene / or a princesse
(base) Ech of yow bothe / is worthy doutelees
(base) To wedden whan tyme is / but nathelees
(base) I speke / as for my suster Emelye
(base) For whom / ye haue this stryf and Ialousye
(base) Ye woot your self. she may nat wedden two
(base) Atones / thogh ye fighten eueremo
(base) That oon of yow / al be hym looth / or lief
(base) He moot go pipen / in an yuy leef
(base) This is to seyn / she may nat now haue bothe
(base) Al be ye neuere so Ialous / ne so wrothe
(base) And for thy / I yow putte in this degree
(base) That ech of yow / shal haue his destynee
(base) As hym is shape / and herkneth in what wyse
(base) Lo here youre ende / of that I shal deuyse
(base) ¶ My wil is this / for plat conclusioun
(base) Withouten any replicacioun
(base) If that yow liketh / take it for the beste
(base) That euerich of yow / shal goon where hym leste
(base) Frely / withouten raunsoun / or daunger
(base) And this day fifty wykes / fer ne neer
(base) Euerich of yow / shal brynge an hundred knyghtes
(base) Armed for listes / vp at alle rightes
(base) Al redy / to darreyne hire by bataille
(base) And this bihoote I yow / withouten faille
(base) Vpon my trouthe / and as I am a knyght
(base) That wheither of yow bothe / that hath myght
(base) This is to seyn / that wheither he or thou
(base) May with his hundred / as I spak of now
(base) Sleen his contrarie / or out of lystes dryue
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Thanne shal I yeue / Emelye to wyue
(base) To whom that Fortune / yeueth so fair a grace
(base) The lystes / shal I maken in this place
(base) And god so wisly / on my soule rewe
(base) As I shal / euene Iuge been and trewe
(base) Ye shul noon oother ende / with me maken
(base) That oon of yow / ne shal be deed / or taken
(base) And if yow thynketh / this is wel ysayd
(base) Sey youre auys / and holdeth yow apayd
(base) This is youre ende / and youre conclusioun
(base) ¶ Who looketh lightly now / but Palamoun
(base) Who spryngeth vp for ioye / but Arcite
(base) Who koude telle / or who koude it endite
(base) The ioye / that is maked in the place
(base) Whan Theseus / hath doon so fair a grace
(base) But doun on knees / wente euery maner wight
(base) And thonken hym / with al hir herte and myght
(base) And namely the Thebans ofte sythe
(base) And thus with good hope / and herte blythe
(base) They take hir leeue / and homward gonne they ryde
(base) To Thebes / with olde walles wyde
(base) I trowe / men wolde deme it necligence
(base) If I foryete / to tellen the despence
(base) Of Theseus / that gooth so bisily
(base) To maken vp the lystes / roially
(base) That swich a noble Theatre / as it was
(base) I dar wel seyn / in this world ther nas
(base) The circuit a myle was aboute
(base) Walled of stoon / and dyched al withoute
(base) Round was the shap / in manere of compas
(base) Ful of degrees / the heighte of sixty paas
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) That whan a man / was set on o degree
(base) He letted noght his felawe for to see
(base) ¶ Estward ther stood a gate / of Marbul whit
(base) Westward / right swich another / in the oposit
(base) And shortly to concluden / swich a place
(base) Was noon in erthe / as in so lite a space
(base) For in the lond / ther was no crafty man
(base) That Geometrye / or Ars metrik kan
(base) Ne purtreyour / ne keruere of ymages
(base) That Theseus / ne yaf mete and wages
(base) The Theatre / for to maken and deuyse
(base) And for to doon / his ryte and sacrifise
(base) He Estward hath / vpon the gate aboue
(base) In worship of venus / goddesse of loue
(base) Doon maad an Auter / and an oratorie
(base) And on the westward / in memorie
(base) Of Mars / he maked hath right swich another
(base) That coste largely / of gold a fother
(base) And Northward / in a touret on the wal
(base) Of Alabastre whit and reed Coral
(base) An oratorie / riche for to see
(base) In worship / of Diane of chastitee
(base) Hath Theseus / doon wroght in noble wise
(base) ¶ But yet hadde I forgeten / to deuyse
(base) The noble keruyng and the purtreitures
(base) The shap / the contenance / and the figures
(base) That weren / in thise oratories thre
(base) ¶ First / in the temple of Venus / mayst thow se
(base) Wroght on the wal / ful pitous to biholde
(base) The broken slepes / and the sykes colde
(base) The sacred teerys / and the waymentynge
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) The firy strokes / of the desirynge
(base) That loues seruantz / in this lyf enduren
(base) The othes / that hir couenantz assuren
(base) Plesance / and hope / desir / foolhardynesse
(base) Beautee and youthe / baudrye / richesse
(base) Charmes and force / lesynges / flaterye
(base) Despense / bisynesse / and Ialousye
(base) That wered / of yelowe gooldes a gerland
(base) And a Cokkow / sittyng on hir hand
(base) Festes / Instrumentz / caroles / daunces
(base) Lust and array / and alle the circumstaunces
(base) Of loue / whiche that I rekned / and rekne shal
(base) By ordre / weren peynted on the wal
(base) And mo / than I kan make of mencioun
(base) For soothly / al the Mount of Citheroun
(base) Ther Venus / hath hir principal dwellynge
(base) Was shewed on the wal / in purtreyynge
(base) With al the gardyn / and the lustynesse
(base) Nat was foryeten / the porter ydelnesse
(base) Ne Narcisus the faire / of yoore agon
(base) Ne yet the folie / of kyng Salomon
(base) The enchauntement of medea and hardynesse
(base) Of Iason I wil not now expresse
(base) Ne yet the grete strengthe of Ercules
(base) The enchantementz / of Medea and Circes
(base) Ne of Turnus / with the hardy fiers corage
(base) The ryche Cresus / caytif in seruage
(base) ¶ Thus may ye seen / that wisdom ne richesse
(base) Beautee / ne sleighte / strengthe hardynesse
(base) Ne may with venus / maken champartie
(base) For as hir lust the world than may she gye
(base) Lo al this folk so caught were in hir laas
(base) Til they for wo / ful ofte seyde allas
